HomePage.title: FPVTune
HomePage.description: AI-powered FPV drone PID tuning and configuration optimization assistant

landing.heroDesc: Upload your Betaflight blackbox logs and get optimized PID settings in seconds. Our AI analyzes gyro noise, identifies resonance frequencies, and generates the perfect tune for your FPV drone.

whatIsPid.title: What is Betaflight PID Tuning?
whatIsPid.desc1: is the process of adjusting your flight controller's Proportional, Integral, and Derivative gains to achieve optimal flight performance. Proper PID tuning eliminates oscillations, reduces prop wash, and makes your FPV drone feel locked-in and responsive.
whatIsPid.desc2: Traditional PID tuning requires hours of test flights, analyzing blackbox logs manually, and making incremental adjustments. Most pilots struggle with understanding gyro noise patterns, filter settings, and the complex relationship between P, I, and D gains.
whatIsPid.desc3: to automate this entire process. Our neural network has been trained on thousands of blackbox logs from various drone configurations, learning the optimal PID settings for different frame sizes, motor combinations, and flying styles.

problems.title: Common PID Tuning Problems
problems.propWashDesc: Vibrations during quick descents or sharp turns caused by turbulent air hitting the propellers.
problems.hotMotorsDesc: Excessive D-gain or inadequate filtering causes motors to overheat and reduces their lifespan.
problems.sluggishDesc: Low P-gains result in slow, mushy stick response that makes precise flying difficult.
problems.midThrottleDesc: Vibrations at certain throttle positions due to motor resonance frequencies.

howItWorksSection.title: How AI-Powered Analysis Works
howItWorksSection.desc: FPVtune analyzes your blackbox data using advanced machine learning to generate optimized settings tailored to your specific drone configuration.
howItWorksSection.step1Desc: Record a short flight with blackbox logging enabled in Betaflight Configurator. Upload the .BBL or .BFL file to FPVtune. We support Betaflight 4.3, 4.4, and 4.5 log formats.
howItWorksSection.step2Desc: Our neural network performs spectral analysis on your gyro data, identifies noise frequencies, measures step response, and evaluates your current PID performance against thousands of reference tunes.
howItWorksSection.step3Desc: Receive optimized PID values, filter settings, and feedforward gains. Copy the generated CLI commands directly into Betaflight Configurator and enjoy a perfectly tuned FPV drone.

featuresSection.title: Advanced Analysis Features
featuresSection.desc: Everything you need to achieve the perfect tune for your FPV drone, from noise analysis to thermal prediction.
featuresSection.spectralDesc: Visualizes gyro noise and D-term resonance across the frequency spectrum. Our AI identifies the exact frequencies where dynamic notch filters should be placed for optimal noise reduction without adding latency.
featuresSection.cliExportDesc: Generate Betaflight CLI commands instantly. Copy and paste directly into your flight controller for immediate results.
featuresSection.thermalDesc: Aggressive PID tuning can overheat motors. Our AI predicts motor temperature based on your noise profile and recommends safe D-gain limits to protect your hardware.
featuresSection.dynamicFilterDesc: Automatically configure gyro lowpass, D-term lowpass, and dynamic notch filters. Minimize filtering delay while maintaining clean motor signals for the smoothest possible flight.
featuresSection.propWashElimDesc: Our AI optimizes D_min, D_max, and feedforward settings specifically to eliminate prop wash oscillation during aggressive maneuvers and quick descents.

supported.title: PID Tuning for Every FPV Drone
supported.desc: Whether you fly a tiny whoop, 5-inch freestyle quad, or 7-inch long range build, FPVtune delivers optimized Betaflight PID settings for your specific configuration.
supported.escProtocolsDesc: Compatible with DShot150, DShot300, DShot600, and bidirectional DShot for RPM filtering.
supported.gyroChipDesc: Works with MPU6000, ICM20689, ICM42688, BMI270, and all other common gyroscopes.
supported.flyingStyleDesc: Optimized profiles for freestyle, racing, cinematic, and long-range flying styles.

whyChoose.title: Why Choose FPVtune?
whyChoose.desc: Stop guessing and start flying with confidence. Our AI-powered approach delivers consistent, reliable results that traditional methods cannot match.

guide.title: Complete Betaflight PID Tuning Guide
guide.desc: Master the fundamentals of Betaflight PID tuning and understand how each parameter affects your drone's flight characteristics.
guide.pGain: Understanding P Gain in Betaflight PID Tuning
guide.pGainDesc: The Proportional gain determines how aggressively your drone corrects errors. Higher P values make the quad more responsive but can cause oscillations. In Betaflight PID tuning, finding the right P gain is crucial for achieving crisp stick response without introducing vibrations.
guide.iGain: The Role of I Gain in Betaflight PID Tuning
guide.iGainDesc: Integral gain helps your drone maintain attitude against external forces like wind. During Betaflight PID tuning, proper I gain settings ensure your quad holds its position without drifting. Too much I gain causes slow oscillations, while too little results in poor hover stability.
guide.dGain: D Gain Optimization in Betaflight PID Tuning
guide.dGainDesc: Derivative gain dampens oscillations and reduces prop wash. Effective Betaflight PID tuning requires careful D gain adjustment to eliminate bounce-back without overheating motors. FPVtune analyzes your noise profile to recommend optimal D values for your specific setup.
guide.filter: Filter Settings in Betaflight PID Tuning
guide.filterDesc: Proper filter configuration is essential for successful Betaflight PID tuning. Gyro and D-term lowpass filters remove noise that can cause motor heating. Dynamic notch filters target specific resonance frequencies. FPVtune automatically calculates optimal filter cutoffs based on your blackbox data.
guide.feedforward: Feedforward in Modern Betaflight PID Tuning
guide.feedforwardDesc: Feedforward anticipates stick movements for instant response. Advanced Betaflight PID tuning includes feedforward optimization to reduce latency and improve stick feel. Our AI analyzes your flying style to recommend feedforward values that match your preferences.
guide.rpm: RPM Filtering and Betaflight PID Tuning
guide.rpmDesc: Bidirectional DShot enables RPM-based filtering for cleaner motor signals. When performing Betaflight PID tuning with RPM filtering, you can run higher PID gains with less filtering delay. FPVtune detects RPM filter status and adjusts recommendations accordingly.

faq.title: Betaflight PID Tuning FAQ
faq.desc: Common questions about Betaflight PID tuning and how FPVtune can help you achieve the perfect tune.
faq.q1: What is the best way to start Betaflight PID tuning?
faq.a1: The best approach to Betaflight PID tuning is to start with a clean blackbox log from a hover and light maneuvers. Upload this log to FPVtune for AI analysis. Our system will identify noise patterns and generate optimized PID settings as a starting point for your tune.
faq.q2: How long does Betaflight PID tuning usually take?
faq.a2: Traditional Betaflight PID tuning can take hours or even days of test flights and adjustments. With FPVtune, you can get optimized PID settings in under 30 seconds. Simply upload your blackbox log and receive instant recommendations tailored to your drone.
faq.q3: Can FPVtune help with Betaflight PID tuning for racing drones?
faq.a3: Yes, FPVtune supports Betaflight PID tuning for all drone types including racing quads. Our AI has been trained on thousands of racing drone logs and understands the specific requirements for low-latency, high-response tunes that competitive pilots need.
faq.q4: Do I need experience with Betaflight PID tuning to use FPVtune?
faq.a4: No prior Betaflight PID tuning experience is required. FPVtune is designed for pilots of all skill levels. Our AI handles the complex analysis and provides ready-to-use CLI commands. Just copy and paste into Betaflight Configurator to apply your optimized tune.
faq.q5: What Betaflight versions are supported for PID tuning?
faq.a5: FPVtune supports Betaflight PID tuning for versions 4.3, 4.4, and 4.5. Our AI understands the differences between firmware versions and generates appropriate settings for your specific Betaflight installation. We regularly update our models to support the latest Betaflight releases.

cta.title: Ready to Optimize Your Drone?
cta.desc: Get AI-optimized Betaflight PID settings in seconds. Pay only when you are satisfied with the analysis results.
cta.supportedFiles: Supports .BBL and .BFL files from Betaflight 4.3, 4.4, and 4.5

footer.tagline: AI-powered Betaflight PID tuning for FPV pilots worldwide.

item-1.question: Do you offer a free trial?
item-1.answer: Yes, we offer a 7-day free trial.

item-2.question: How do I cancel my subscription?
item-2.answer: You can cancel your subscription by visiting the billing page.

item-3.question: Can I change my plan?
item-3.answer: Yes, you can change your plan at any time by visiting the billing page.

item-4.question: What is the refund policy?
item-4.answer: We offer a 30-day money-back guarantee if you are not happy with our product.

item-5.question: Can't find what you're looking for?
item-5.answer: Please contact our customer support team at support@fpvtune.com

blackbox.title: Blackbox Deep Analysis
blackbox.description: AI analyzes your flight logs, identifies vibration, overshoot, latency issues, and pinpoints tuning direction.

hardware.title: Hardware-Adaptive Optimization
hardware.description: Generates optimal PID and filter parameters based on your motor, frame, and propeller combination.

import.title: One-Click Config Import
import.description: Generated tuning can be copied directly to Betaflight CLI, or downloaded as a config file for one-click import.

q1.question: What files do I need to upload?
q1.answer: Blackbox log files (.bbl/.bfl) for flight data analysis, CLI dump for current config. Recommend recording 30+ seconds of normal flight.

q2.question: How long does AI analysis take?
q2.answer: Usually completes within 1-2 minutes. Complex log files may take longer, you'll be notified by email when done.

q3.question: Which flight controller firmware is supported?
q3.answer: Currently supports Betaflight 4.3+, INAV 6.0+ and EmuFlight. KISS and other firmware support is in development.

q4.question: Can I use the generated parameters directly?
q4.answer: AI-generated parameters are an optimized starting point based on your data. Recommend test flying in a safe environment and fine-tuning based on feel.

q5.question: Is my data secure?
q5.answer: Your flight data is only used for analysis and won't be stored or shared. Data is automatically deleted after analysis.
